title: Awesome Geek Podcasts
description: A curated list of podcasts we like to listen to. Old/Original list.

podcasts.name: .NET Rocks!
podcasts.description: The internet audio talk show for .NET developer with Carl Franklin and Richard Campbell.

podcasts.name: /dev/hell
podcasts.description: Chris Hartjes and Ed Finkler are trapped in Development Hell, where they talk mostly about PHP, web, their development experiences and also with special guests.

podcasts.name: Accidental Tech Podcast
podcasts.description: Three nerds discussing tech, Apple, programming, and loosely related matters.

podcasts.name: Almost Better Than Silence
podcasts.description: A comedy podcast about video games that features technology news, guest interviews, and conversation games!

podcasts.name: Android Developers Backstage
podcasts.description: Android Backstage, a podcast by and for Android developers. Hosted by developers from the Android engineering team, this show covers topics of interest to Android programmers, with in-depth discussions and interviews with engineers on the Android team at Google.

podcasts.name: Away from Keyboard
podcasts.description: Exploring the human side of creative work.

podcasts.name: AWS re:Invent 2015
podcasts.description: iTunes RSS- 230+ technical sessions covering architecture, operations, security, and more.

podcasts.name: Azure Friday
podcasts.description: Scott Hanselman sits down with the actual engineers who build Azure on his journey to learn how to program the cloud. No marketing, no BS, just two engineers and a laptop in short managable chunks.

podcasts.name: Base.cs
podcasts.description: Beginner-friendly computer science lessons based on Vaidehi Joshi's base.cs blog series, produced by CodeNewbie.

podcasts.name: Beats, Rye & Types
podcasts.description: Two old friends, discuss their three main obsessions: music, food, and programming.

podcasts.name: Between Screens
podcasts.description: Expect to find content about the following topics: Ruby, Rails, Sinatra, Sass, Javascript, Design Patterns, Jekyll, Client-Side Web Apps, Rust, Typography, Git, Responsive Design, Prototyping, Web Design, Type Design and more.

podcasts.name: Blockchain Insider
podcasts.description: Weekly podcast specialising in all things blockchain, ledger technology and crypto currencies.

podcasts.name: Boagworld Show
podcasts.description: Boagworld is a podcast about digital strategy, management and user experience. It offers practical advice, news, tools, review and interviews with leading figures in the web design community.

podcasts.name: BookBytes
podcasts.description: A book club podcast for developers.

podcasts.name: Bootstrapped
podcasts.description: Both Ian and Andrey are experience startup founders, both have had major blows and successes in their career. You can learn alot listening to them.

podcasts.name: Bootstrapped Web
podcasts.description: Bootstrapped Web is for entrepreneurs bootstrapping their startups, who believe that the best way to get to where we're going is to learn by doing.

podcasts.name: BSDNow
podcasts.description: A Weekly BSD Podcast - News, Interviews and Tutorials.

podcasts.name: BSDTalk
podcasts.description: Talking about the BSD family of free operating systems.

podcasts.name: Cloudcast
podcasts.description: Award-winning podcast on all things, Cloud Computing, AWS Ecosystem, OpenSource, DevOps, AppDev, SaaS and SDN.

podcasts.name: CMOS
podcasts.description: The Code-Maven Open Source podcast helps you become familiar with a wide range of projects by interviewing users or developers of these projects.

podcasts.name: CodeNewbie Podcast
podcasts.description: Stories from people on their coding journey.

podcasts.name: CoRecursive Interviews
podcasts.description: In-Depth interviews with software development experts.  Focusing on functional programming and languages like scala / haskell / F# / erlang / idris / kotlin.

podcasts.name: Command Line Heroes
podcasts.description: A new podcast about the people who transform technology from the command line up.

podcasts.name: Cortex
podcasts.description: Content creators CGP Grey and Myke Hurley discuss their processes, productivity hacks, workflows, and general working lives.

podcasts.name: CppCast
podcasts.description: The first podcast by C++ developers for C++ developers.

podcasts.name: Creative Coding Podcast
podcasts.description: about programming for visual and creative applications.

podcasts.name: CTRL+Click Cast
podcasts.description: They "inspect the web for you". Interviews with developers and designers, about design, code, and content management systems. Hosted by Lea Alcantara and Emily Lewis.

podcasts.name: Curious Minds
podcasts.description: Curious Minds is a podcast about Science, Technology, and History. Each episode brings interesting stories from a wide range of subjects: from Physics and Astronomy to Medicine, Art and Science Fiction.

podcasts.name: Darknet Diaries
podcasts.description: Stories from hackers or those who have been attacked. How they got in and what happened.

podcasts.name: Data Skeptic
podcasts.description: The Data Skeptic Podcast features interviews and discussion of topics related to data science, statistics, machine learning, artificial intelligence and the like.

podcasts.name: Data Stories
podcasts.description: Enrico Bertini and Moritz Stefaner discuss the latest developments in data analytics, visualization and related topics.

podcasts.name: Design vs Dev
podcasts.description: A podcast about web development from the different perspectives of designers and developers.

podcasts.name: DevChat.tv
podcasts.description: We are programmers. House of Ruby Rogues, Javascript Jabber, IPhreaks, Freelancers' Show, Adventures in Angular and RailsClips.

podcasts.name: Developer On Fire
podcasts.description: Podcast with inspiring interviews with successful software developers, architects, testers, and other professionals with stories of success, failure, excellence, and inspiration.

podcasts.name: DevelopersHangout
podcasts.description: Two Developers talk about challeges, articles, news, books and other podcasts that came across their radar every 2 weeks. Laravel, PHP are two key topics, and other great podcasts like the ones listed above.

podcasts.name: Developer Tea
podcasts.description: Podcast for web and software developers hosted by a developer that you can listen to in less than 10 minutes.

podcasts.name: Developing Perspective
podcasts.description: From development and design to marketing and support, Under the Radar is all about independent app development. It's never longer than 30 minutes.

podcasts.name: DevOps Cafe
podcasts.description: In this interview driven show, John Willis and Damon Edwards take a pragmatic look at the technology, tools, and business developments behind the emerging DevOps movement.

podcasts.name: Digital Human
podcasts.description: BBC series explores the digital world presented by Aleks Krotoski.

podcasts.name: Disruptive
podcasts.description: Researchers at the Wyss Institute for Biologically Inspired Engineering use Nature's design principles to develop bioinspired materials and devices that will transform medicine and create a more sustainable world. In this podcast series, Terrence McNally speaks directly with Institute researchers, exploring their motivations and how they envision our future as it might be impacted by their disruptive technologies.

podcasts.name: Eat Sleep Code Podcast
podcasts.description: On the show we’ll be talking to passionate people about a wide range of developer related topics.

podcasts.name: Elixir Foundation
podcasts.description: Your weekly podcast for news & interviews from around the Elixirlang Community.

podcasts.name: Elixir Mix
podcasts.description: Elixir Mix is a weekly show focused on the Elixir programming community.

podcasts.name: Elixir Outlaws
podcasts.description: Panel discussions of topics in and around Elixir development.

podcasts.name: Embedded.fm
podcasts.description: Talk about the how, why, and what of engineering, usually devices.

podcasts.name: FiveJS
podcasts.description: The latest news in the JavaScript community.

podcasts.name: FLOSS Weekly
podcasts.description: Interviews with prominent guests from the free software/open source community.

podcasts.name: Founders Talk
podcasts.description: In-depth, one on one conversations with founders, CEOs, and makers. The journey, lessons learned, and the struggles. Let's do this!

podcasts.name: Full Stack Radio
podcasts.description: A podcast for developers interested in building great software products.

podcasts.name: Functional Geekery
podcasts.description: Functional Geeks, Geeking Functionally.

podcasts.name: Future of Coding
podcasts.description: Monthly interviews.

podcasts.name: Fw:Thinking
podcasts.description: It's about technology. It's about humanity. It's about our future. It's Fw:Thinking.

podcasts.name: Get Up and Code
podcasts.description: Get Up and Code is a podcast about fitness for programmers and software developers. Every week, John Sonmez, helps you lose weight, refactor your diet and get in shape.

podcasts.name: GitMinutes
podcasts.description: The show for proficient Git users.

podcasts.name: Google Cloud Platform Podcast
podcasts.description: The Google Cloud Platform Podcast, coming to you every week. Discussing everything from on Google Cloud Platform from App Engine to Big Query.

podcasts.name: Go Time
podcasts.description: Interesting topics around the Go programming language, building systems, the community, and everything in between.

podcasts.name: Hackaday Podcast
podcasts.description: Hackaday's podcast, talking about the best articles published and hackaday contests.

podcasts.name: HardcoreHistory
podcasts.description: In "Hardcore History" the very unconventional Dan Carlin takes his "Martian", outside-the-box way of thinking and applies it to the past.

podcasts.name: Greater Than Code
podcasts.description: because #peoplematter.

podcasts.name: Harry Potter and the methods of rationality
podcasts.description: This is an alternate universe story, where Petunia married a scientist. Harry enters the wizarding world armed with Enlightenment ideals and the experimental spirit.

podcasts.name: HaskellCast
podcasts.description: — A podcast for Haskell developers working in industry.

podcasts.name: Hello Internet
podcasts.description: Science youtubers CGP Grey and Brady Haran discuss everything from flag design to Star Wars.

podcasts.name: Houston We Have a Podcast
podcasts.description: Official Johnson Space Center NASA's podcast. Hosted weekly, its topics are in general about space and the ISS.

podcasts.name: HTTP 203
podcasts.description: In each show Jake and Paul pick a hot topic in the world of web development and discuss the various aspects of it, meanwhile dropping in lifehacks, lessons and some rather honest truths.

podcasts.name: Iron Sysadmin
podcasts.description: A Podcast by real world sysadmins, for real world sysadmins.

podcasts.name: IRL: Because Online Life Is Real Life
podcasts.description: Host Veronica Belmont shares real stories of life online and real talk about the future of the Web. IRL is an original podcast from Mozilla.

podcasts.name: Javascript to Elm
podcasts.description: A podcast about using Elm coming from Javascript and other languages.

podcasts.name: JS Party
podcasts.description: A community celebration of JavaScript and the web.

podcasts.name: Laravel News Podcast
podcasts.description: The Laravel News Podcast brings you all the latest news and events related to Laravel.

podcasts.name: Linear Digressions
podcasts.description: Explores topics of data science and machine learning in an accessible way through real-world stories and examples.

podcasts.name: Linux Action News
podcasts.description: Weekly news about Linux and the open source world.

podcasts.name: Listen and Learn about AWS
podcasts.description: Jeff Barr discusses various aspects of the Amazon Web Services (AWS) offering. Each podcast include AWS news, tech tips, and interviews with startups, AWS partners, and AWS employees.

podcasts.name: Magic Read Along
podcasts.description: A podcast about programming, life and the internet. Topics include FP, OOP, development practices, and a dip into our personal lives from time to time.

podcasts.name: Makers
podcasts.description: Unexpected life moments that have had an impact on today’s most influential and experimental makers.

podcasts.name: Mastering Embedded Systems
podcasts.description: I have identified four major problems in mastering Embedded Systems: 1. Not enough specialists; 2. inadequate design and poor detections of faults; 3. mandatory multi-site approaches are failing; 4. bad mistakes in managing Virtual Teams I'll teach you the know-how and the tools to overcome these challenges.

podcasts.name: Mind the Cloud Podcast
podcasts.description: The podcast about the developers and companies using the cloud to create the future.

podcasts.name: MS Dev Show
podcasts.description: THE podcast for Microsoft developers. Jason Young and Carl Schweitzer talk about the latest in developer news covering topics such as the Azure cloud, Windows, Windows Phone, Visual Studio, and cross-platform development using the Microsoft platform.

podcasts.name: New Rustacean
podcasts.description: This is a podcast about learning the programming language Rust—from scratch.

podcasts.name: Note To Self
podcasts.description: Host Manoush Zomorodi talks with everyone from big name techies to elementary school teachers about the effects of technology on our lives, in a quest for the smart choices that will help you think and live better.

podcasts.name: Office 365 Developer Podcast
podcasts.description: The only show focused on Office 365 development where we talk to the experts from all over the globe coding on the Office 365 platform.

podcasts.name: Packet Pushers
podcasts.description: About data networking by network architects. Deeply technical & unabashedly nerdy.

podcasts.name: Partially Derivative
podcasts.description: A podcast about Data, Nerdiness, and Beer.

podcasts.name: PHP Round Table
podcasts.description: The PHP Roundtable is a casual gathering of developers discussing topics that PHP nerds care about.

podcasts.name: PHP Town Hall
podcasts.description: Town Hall a way for PHP developers to raise questions about current events (or upcoming things) in the PHP community, with different guests each week.

podcasts.name: Podcast._init_
podcasts.description: A podcast about Python and the people who make it great.

podcasts.name: Practical AI
podcasts.description: Making artificial intelligence practical, productive, and accessible to everyone.

podcasts.name: Python Bytes
podcasts.description: Python headlines delivered directly to your earbuds.

podcasts.name: Radiolab
podcasts.description: Radiolab is a show about curiosity. Where sound illuminates ideas, and the boundaries blur between science, philosophy, and human experience.

podcasts.name: React Podcast
podcasts.description: Podcast about React.js.

podcasts.name: Reasonably Sound
podcasts.description: Context, explanation and a little celebration of the complexities and awesomeness of audio, and the various cultures which surround and have grown around it.

podcasts.name: Reply All
podcasts.description: Reply All is a show about the internet.

podcasts.name: Risky Business
podcasts.description: Risky Business was established in February, 2007. It take a lighthearted look at information security news and features.

podcasts.name: Ruby5
podcasts.description: The latest news in the Ruby and Rails community.

podcasts.name: Ruby Rogues
podcasts.description: Ruby Rogues is a weekly panel discussion about programming. Ruby and technologies like Rails are what we have in common, but the discussions cover parts of the Ruby ecosystem, gems (libraries) as well as programming practices, tools, and careers.

podcasts.name: RunAs Radio
podcasts.description: A weekly Internet Audio Talk Show for IT Professionals working with Microsoft products.

podcasts.name: Security Now!
podcasts.description: Security Now! consists of a discussion between Steve Gibson and Leo Laporte of issues of computer security and, conversely, insecurity.

podcasts.name: Security Weekly
podcasts.description: A weekly podcast about security and info sec.

podcasts.name: ShopTalk Show
podcasts.description: Podcast about front end web design, development and UX.

podcasts.name: Software Engineering Radio
podcasts.description: The podcast for professional software developers.

podcasts.name: Soft Skills Engineering
podcasts.description: Weekly advice podcast for software developers. It takes more than great code to be a great developer.

podcasts.name: Sound Of Symfony
podcasts.description: The unofficial Symfony podcast.

podcasts.name: StarTalk Radio
podcasts.description: Program devoted to all things space and is hosted by renowned astrophysicist Neil deGrasse Tyson.

podcasts.name: Sword & Laser
podcasts.description: The Sword and Laser (S&L) is a science fiction and fantasy-themed book club, video show and podcast, started by Veronica Belmont and Tom Merritt.

podcasts.name: Syntax FM
podcasts.description: A Tasty Treats Podcast for Web Developers.

podcasts.name: Sysadministrivia
podcasts.description: Linux, Lagers, and Late Nights.

podcasts.name: Syscast Podcast
podcasts.description: Talking Linux, open source, web development and system administration (DevOps).

podcasts.name: Talking Kotlin
podcasts.description: A bimonthly podcast on Kotlin and more hosted by Hadi Hariri.

podcasts.name: Talking Machines
podcasts.description: Talking Machines is your window into the world of machine learning.

podcasts.name: Talk Python to Me
podcasts.description: Weekly podcast (30 minutes) that covers a wide array of Python topics.

podcasts.name: TechStuff
podcasts.description: TechStuff tackles topics ranging from basic electronics to the Large Hadron Collider and everything in between. TechStuff is dedicated to demystifying technology and its role in our society and culture.

podcasts.name: Test and Code Podcast
podcasts.description: A podcast about Software Development, Software Testing, and Python.

podcasts.name: That Podcast
podcasts.description: Beau and Dave talking about life as dads, programmers, and entrepreneurs.

podcasts.name: The 6 Figure Developer Podcast
podcasts.description: The 6 Figure Developer Podcast is a show dedicated to helping developers to grow their career. Topics include Test Driven Development, Clean Code, Professionalism, Entrepreneurship, as well as the latest and greatest programming languages and concepts.

podcasts.name: The Accidental Engineer
podcasts.description: Interviews with engineers about how they started their career.

podcasts.name: The Amp Hour
podcasts.description: Discussing the world of electronics design in an hour long(ish) weekly show.

podcasts.name: The Back to Front Show
podcasts.description: The Back to Front show was started in 2013 by web industry veterans Keir Whitaker and Kieran Masterton. Over the first 40 episodes they have discussed everything from web design and development to startups and dog related tech.

podcasts.name: The Big Web Show
podcasts.description: It's everything web that matters.

podcasts.name: The Bike Shed
podcasts.description: On The Bike Shed, hosts Derek Prior, Sean Griffin, Laila Winner, and guests discuss their development experience and challenges with Ruby, Rails, JavaScript, and whatever else is drawing their attention, admiration, or ire this week.

podcasts.name: The Changelog
podcasts.description: Conversations with the hackers, leaders, and innovators of software development.

podcasts.name: The Cognicast
podcasts.description: The Cognicast previously ThinkRelevance: The Podcast is the podcast from the Cognitect family.

podcasts.name: The Food Fight Show
podcasts.description: The Podcast where DevOps chefs do battle.

podcasts.name: The Hanselminutes podcast
podcasts.description: Fresh Air for Developers.

podcasts.name: The Laravel Podcast
podcasts.description: The Laravel Podcast brings you Laravel and PHP development news and discussion.

podcasts.name: The Life Scientific
podcasts.description: Professor Jim Al-Khalili talks to leading scientists about their life and work, finding out what inspires and motivates them and asking what their discoveries might do for mankind.

podcasts.name: The Manifest
podcasts.description: A podcast all about package management.

podcasts.name: The Music Makers
podcasts.description: The best articles from around the web, curated and read to you.

podcasts.name: The Ship Show
podcasts.description: Build engineering, DevOps, release management & everything in between!

podcasts.name: The Web Platform Podcast
podcasts.description: A weekly show that dives deep into all things web from the developers building the platform today.

podcasts.name: This Developer's Life
podcasts.description: A podcast about developers and their lives.

podcasts.name: Thoughtbot
podcasts.description: We record and release weekly podcasts from thoughtbot on design, Ruby on Rails, iOS, running software companies, and maintaining work/life balance.

podcasts.name: ThoughtWorks
podcasts.description: A community of passionate individuals whose purpose is to revolutionize software design, creation and delivery, while advocating for positive social change.

podcasts.name: Three Devs and a Maybe
podcasts.description: Weekly discussion podcast on all things web development. Topics range from daily developer life, PHP, frameworks, testing, good software design and our experiences using many other programming languages.

podcasts.name: Toolsday Podcast
podcasts.description: A 20-ish-minute podcast about the latest in tech tools, tips, and tricks on Tuesdays at 2!

podcasts.name: Ubuntu Podcast
podcasts.description: A lively and upbeat podcast made by members of the Ubuntu UK LoCo that includes news, discussion and interviews from the Ubuntu and Open Source communities.

podcasts.name: Web of Tomorrow
podcasts.description: Podcast about JavaScript and front-end web development.

podcasts.name: Why Are Computers
podcasts.description: A podcast about computers and computer programs and why.

podcasts.name: WIRED's Webmonkey Podcast
podcasts.description: Glance behind the scenes of WIRED.com with the tech team.

podcasts.name: Breach
podcasts.description: A podcast exploring data breaches and cybersecurity by Carbonite.

podcasts.name: Laravel Portugal Live
podcasts.description: Os membros do Laravel Portugal reunem-se para falar sobre Laravel, PHP, a comunidade Portuguesa, ideias e muito mais. @joselaborges.

podcasts.name: Ubuntu Portugal (podcast)
podcasts.description: A comunidade Ubuntu Portugal (Ubuntu-PT) é a comunidade Portuguesa de suporte à distribuição de GNU/Linux, Ubuntu. Esta comunidade consiste num grupo de pessoas que voluntariamente se dedica não só a promover a utilização do sistema operativo Ubuntu e do software livre em geral, mas também a dar suporte aos utilizadores portugueses desta distribuição de GNU/Linux.

podcasts.name: 10deploys
podcasts.description: São discutidas as origens, tendências, influências e os conceitos por trás do DevOps com o objetivo de ajudar organizações a se transformarem em organizações de alto desempenho.

podcasts.name: CapyCast
podcasts.description: Podcast com o Time de Produto da Resultados Digitais sobre os seus aprendizados em Desenvolvimento e Design.

podcasts.name: DevDrops
podcasts.description: O seu podcast sobre desenvolvimento de software.

podcasts.name: DevNaEstrada
podcasts.description: Podcast semanal sobre desenvolvimento web com uma pitada de humor.

podcasts.name: DioCast
podcasts.description: Podcast sobre Linux e Software Livre.

podcasts.name: Elemencast
podcasts.description: A proposta é levar ao ouvinte drops de conteúdo diversos a respeito do universo Front-End, NodeJs, Programação Funcional etc.

podcasts.name: Elixir em Foco
podcasts.description: Elixir em Foco é um podcast em que conversamos com pessoas da comunidade brasileira de desenvolvedores de software sobre a linguagem de programação Elixir.

podcasts.name: Emílias Podcast - Mulheres na Computação
podcasts.description: Um projeto de extensão da UTFPR Curitiba que entrevista mulheres da área de Computação e afins, explorando suas motivações e desafios, com o bjetivo de incentivar a presença feminina na tecnologia.

podcasts.name: Fronteiras da Engenharia de Software
podcasts.description: Fronteiras da Engenharia de Software é um podcast para refletir sobre o presente e o futuro da engenharia de software.

Hacking, hacktivismo y seguridad.

podcasts.description: A podcast hosted by Terry Tai, Dingding Ye and Daniel Lv, Most topics are about software development, startups, etc.

podcasts.name: DevTalk
podcasts.description: Tech podcast for passionate developers. All topics related to dev: architecture, languages, tools, libraries, conferences, community, career planning... Hosted by Maciej Aniserowicz.

podcasts.name: Just4Fun
podcasts.description: Biweekly tech podcast hosted by Rafal Warzycha and Piotr Leszczynski. Main topics are JavaScript and frontend.

podcasts.name: Webbidevaus.fi
podcasts.description: Weekly podcast about web-development. Hosted by Antti Mattila and Riku Rouvila.

podcasts.name: Teman Macet
podcasts.description: Tentang programming dan industri informatika.

podcasts.name: BNR: Digitaal
podcasts.description: Herbert Blankesteijn schakelt tussen internet, computer en telefonie.

podcasts.name: BNR: De Technoloog
podcasts.description: Herbert Blankesteijn en Ben van der Burg in gesprek met spraakmakende experts over technologische ontwikkelingen en de impact op onze samenleving.

podcasts.name: De Appels en Peren Show
podcasts.description: Een talkshow over en uit de toekomst. Technologie, media, cultuur en alles wat verder de toekomst mogelijk maakt.

podcasts.name: Tech45
podcasts.description: Tech45 is een wekelijkse technologiepodcast. In ongeveer 45 minuten loodst een panel geeks je door het interessantste technieuws van de voorbije week.

podcasts.name: Met Nerds om Tafel
podcasts.description: Wekelijkse podcast waarin nerds Spa Rood drinken en praten over tech-onderwerpen. Met regelmatig gastnerds en vaste tafelnerds Daniel Kegel, Floris Diemel, Joost Schellevis, Jurian Ubachs en Randal Peelen.
